mvector LOCAL mvector

NAME

mjo_vector_permute_push — Permute a string and append the result to the end of the vector

SYNOPSIS

#include <mvector.h>

void
mjo_vector_permute_push(mjo_vector_t *const io_var, unsigned char const *i_str);

DESCRIPTION

Transform (permute) a string to a vector's internal representation (data type) and then append it.

mjo_vector_variant_struct resize the vector by object size octets (i_size_struct argument of mjo_vector_malloc()) and then append i_size_struct octets of i_str to the end of the vector.
mjo_vector_variant_ptrstr resize the vector by the size of an address/pointer (ptrdiff_t) and then copy the address of a newly duplicated string i_str onto the end of the vector.
mjo_vector_variant_char resize the vector by strlen(3) of i_str and then copy the octets of i_str onto the end of the vector.
mjo_vector_variant_short resize the vector by the size of a short and then convert (mjo_str_to_short()) the ASCII numeric value to a short and store the value at the end of the vector.
mjo_vector_variant_ushort resize the vector by the size of an unsigned short and then convert (mjo_str_to_ushort()) the ASCII numeric value to a unsigned short and store the value at the end of the vector.
mjo_vector_variant_bool resize the vector by the size of an int and then convert (mjo_str_to_bool()) the ASCII numeric value to a boolean and store the value at the end of the vector.

A boolean value of true can be one of the following conditions:

  • i_str is nill
  • i_str is empty
  • *i_str is equal to '1'
  • *i_str is equal to 't'
  • *i_str is equal to 'T'
mjo_vector_variant_int resize the vector by the size of an int and then convert (mjo_str_to_int()) the ASCII numeric value to an int and store the value at the end of the vector.
mjo_vector_variant_uint resize the vector by the size of an unsigned int and then convert (mjo_str_to_uint()) the ASCII numeric value to an unsigned int and store the value at the end of the vector.
mjo_vector_variant_long resize the vector by the size of a long and then convert (mjo_str_to_long()) the ASCII numeric value to a long and store the value at the end of the vector.
mjo_vector_variant_ulong resize the vector by the size of an unsigned long and then convert (mjo_str_to_ulong()) the ASCII numeric value to a unsigned long and store the value at the end of the vector.
mjo_vector_variant_size_t resize the vector by the size of a size_t and then convert (mjo_str_to_size_t()) the ASCII numeric value to a size_t and store the value at the end of the vector.
mjo_vector_variant_ptrdiff_t resize the vector by the size of a ptrdiff_t and then convert (mjo_str_to_ptrdiff_t()) the ASCII numeric value to ptrdiff_t and store the value at the end of the vector.
mjo_vector_variant_double resize the vector by the size of a double and then convert (mjo_str_to_pa(double))
the ASCII numeric value to a double and store the value at the end of the vector.

Following is a description of the arguments.

io_var
pointer to a ‘mjo_vector_t’ to add an object too
i_str
a value in ASCII representation to permute and append to the vector

If io_var or i_str is nil, or *i_str is empty, it shall be denoted as an invalid argument.

The number of elements in the vector will increase by one.

RETURN VALUES

If any of the arguments are invalid, the return code shall be MJO_FAIL and errno shall be set to EINVAL.

If the internal size (i_size_struct argument of mjo_vector_malloc()) is zero, errno shall be set to E2BIG and return code shall be MJO_FAIL.

If the conversion fails, errno shall be set ERANGE to denote a conversion issue and the return code shall be MJO_FAIL. Upon success, the return value shall be MJO_OK.

November 25, 2021 OpenBSD 7.0
